page.title: 05IRON AGE REMAINS
page.content: Iron age remains Blackhead. A cliff castle of 4 acres can still be seen to the south of the Headland Hotel.It has a single bank and ditch accross the neck.It is one of 4 recorded in the Parish.Lankidden can still be seen.Blackhead and Dolor Point show few remains. Cliff castles are dated to the iron age 500BC. A field near Blackhead has the Celtic name of CRUKEHEEIR and contains a barrow. Pottery and flints have been found all over the area. A barn on Chynhalls Farm is said to have been a Pilgrim Chapel.
